Cardiovascular Diseases/Vascular Diseases/Cerebrovascular Disorders/Intracranial Embolism and Thrombosis/Intracranial Thrombosis/Sinus Thrombosis, Intracranial/Sagittal Sinus Thrombosis

Nervous System Diseases/Central Nervous System Diseases/Brain Diseases/Cerebrovascular Disorders/Intracranial Embolism and Thrombosis/Intracranial Thrombosis/Sinus Thrombosis, Intracranial/Sagittal Sinus Thrombosis
Record.Description: Formation or presence of a blood clot (THROMBUS) in the SUPERIOR SAGITTAL SINUS or the inferior sagittal sinus. Sagittal sinus thrombosis can result from infections, hematological disorders, CRANIOCEREBRAL TRAUMA; and NEUROSURGICAL PROCEDURES. Clinical features are primarily related to the increased intracranial pressure causing HEADACHE; NAUSEA; and VOMITING. Severe cases can evolve to SEIZURES or COMA.
